_header: Ye devout people which have observance
_description: John Lydgate, On Kissing at ‘Verbum caro factum est’ — four 8-line stanzas

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
YE devout peple which kepe an observaunce meekly in chirche to
                    kysse stoon or tre…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…And euere haue mynde on crystys passyoun wich for thy sake
                    weryd a crowne of thorn
BodLauMis683.Attributed Title:
HEre begynneth a tretis of the knelyng and kyssyng maad at verbum caro
                    factum est (f. 87v)

OxfBal354.First Lines:
O devout peple þat kepe an aff observanceLowly in
                    church to kysse stone or treErth or yren bothe in remembravnceWhat
                    they do meane take in moralite…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…Your mowth first crossid of high devocounKyssyng the tokyns
                    rehersid here be fore& euer haue mynd on crystes passyounWhich for
                    your sake werid a crown of thornAmenExplicit
OxfBal354.Facsimiles:
Early Manuscripts at Oxford University: Facsimile
                    of Oxford, Balliol MS 354.
         (http://image.ox.ac.uk/show?collection=balliol&manuscript=ms354).

CamGon174.First Lines:
O devout people which kepe an obseruance louly in chyrch to kysse
                    ston or tre…
CamGon174.Last Lines:
…And euer haue mynd on crystis passion Which for oure sakys
                    dyd were a crovn of thorn
CamGon174.Note:
Scribe ends, ‘Explicit expliciat ludere scriptor est‘ (p.
                    455)

CamTCC600.First Lines:
Ye devoute people whiche kepe an observaunce Meekly in chirche to
                    kisse stone or tree Eerþe or yren kepeþe remembrance What
                    þey mene takeþe þe moralitee…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…And ever haue mynde of cristes passiion Which for þy
                    sake wered þe crowne of thorne
CamTCC600.Attributed Title:
A balade made by þe munk of Bury whiles it is seyde verbum caro factum
                    est (p. 362)

CamTCC601.First Lines:
a deuout pepyll whyche kepe an obseruaunce Lowly in churche to
                    kysse stoone or tre…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…And euer haue mynde on crystes passioun Whyche for youre sake
                    weryd a crowne of thorne
CamTCC601.Attributed Title:
A lytyll compilacioun declaryng when men kysse in Churche stoone or erthe
                    Tymber or Iron what they shuld remembre therby (f. 215); Verbum Caro factum est
                    (f. 215, added by later hand)
CamTCC601.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 116-7.

BLAdd34360.First Lines:
[Y]E devoute peple whiche kepe on observaunceMekely in chirche to
                    kysse stone or tre…
BLAdd34360.Last Lines:
…And euer have mynd on cristes passiounWhiche for thi sake
                    wered a Crowne of thorn

BLHar2251.First Lines:
Ye devoute people whiche kepe one obseruaunceMekely in chirche to
                    kysse stone or tree…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…And euer have mynd on cristis passiounwhiche for thy sake
                    wered a crowne of thorne
BLHar2251.Editions:
Halliwell-Phillipps,  James Orchard,
                        ed.  
             A Selection from the Minor Poems of Don John Lydgate.
Percy Society
         2. London: T. Richard, 1840: 60-1.

BLHar2255.First Lines:
YE devout peeple which keepe an observaunceMeekly in chirche to
                    kisse stoon or tre…
BLHar2255.Last Lines:
…And evir haue mynde on cristis passiounwhich for thy sake
                    weryd a crowne of thorn Explicit
